name: Forced March (Extended Travel)
description: Extended travel beyond the normal 8-hour daily limit. Characters can push themselves to travel for additional hours per day at the risk of exhaustion. This represents the strain of traveling beyond the body's normal sustainable limits, whether to reach a destination urgently or to escape danger.

movement.baseRequirement: 8 hours of travel at chosen pace (Fast, Normal, or Slow)

exhaustionMechanics.trigger: At the end of each hour of travel beyond 8 hours

savingThrow.scaling: +1 DC for each hour past 8 hours

exhaustionMechanics.onSuccess: No exhaustion gained for that hour
exhaustionMechanics.cumulative: Each failed save adds another level of Exhaustion

exhaustionEffects.description: Exhaustion is a cumulative condition with severe consequences

levels.effects: D20 Tests reduced by 2, Speed reduced by 5 feet
D20 Tests reduced by 4, Speed reduced by 10 feet
D20 Tests reduced by 6, Speed reduced by 15 feet
D20 Tests reduced by 8, Speed reduced by 20 feet
D20 Tests reduced by 10, Speed reduced by 25 feet

exhaustionEffects.recovery: Finishing a Long Rest removes 1 Exhaustion level
exhaustionEffects.removal: When Exhaustion level reaches 0, the condition ends

mechanicalEffects: Each hour beyond 8 requires a Constitution saving throw
DC starts at 11 (for hour 9) and increases by 1 each additional hour
Failed saves result in gaining 1 level of Exhaustion
Exhaustion reduces all D20 Tests by 2 per level
Exhaustion reduces Speed by 5 feet per level
Multiple levels of exhaustion can be gained in a single extended travel period
strategicConsiderations: Risk increases dramatically with each additional hour
High Constitution characters can travel longer safely
Party must consider whether the time gained is worth the exhaustion risk
Accumulated exhaustion affects combat ability if encounters occur

restrictions: Still subject to all travel pace restrictions (terrain, speed reductions, etc.)
Each character makes their own saving throw - some may gain exhaustion while others don't
Exhaustion gained reduces Speed, which may force the group to Slow pace
If any group member's Speed is reduced to half or less, entire group must use Slow pace
Characters already exhausted face increasing penalties on subsequent saves

specialCircumstances.highAltitude: At 10,000+ feet elevation, each hour counts as 2 hours for extended travel purposes (unless acclimated)
specialCircumstances.mountedTravel: Mounts have their own exhaustion mechanics and may not be able to sustain extended travel
specialCircumstances.vehicles: Characters in vehicles don't make these saves, but drivers/pilots might at GM discretion
specialCircumstances.magicalSpeed: Special movement from spells or items may bypass some terrain restrictions but not exhaustion from extended hours

calculations.totalDistance: Base pace × total hours traveled (if character can maintain the pace)

examples: Racing to reach a city before siege engines arrive (traveling 12 hours per day)
Fleeing across the wilderness from pursuing enemies for multiple days
Urgent diplomatic mission requiring faster-than-normal travel
Trying to reach safety before nightfall in dangerous territory
Pushing through the final miles to reach a destination despite fatigue
Emergency evacuation or rescue mission with time constraints

foundryVTT.automation: Can trigger automatic Constitution saving throws at the end of each extended hour
foundryVTT.tracking: Tracks hours traveled and exhaustion DC progression
foundryVTT.exhaustionManagement: Automatically applies exhaustion penalties to character sheets
foundryVTT.journalEntries: Records forced march attempts and exhaustion gained
foundryVTT.warnings: Alerts GM when characters are approaching dangerous exhaustion levels
foundryVTT.skillChecks: Applies exhaustion penalties to all D20 Tests automatically

notes.riskVsReward: Forced marches can save time but risk leaving the party weakened for encounters
notes.partyDynamics: Low-Constitution characters may force the party to stop or split up
notes.strategicPlanning: Should be planned carefully - exhaustion takes multiple long rests to recover
notes.compounding: Exhaustion from multiple days of forced march can accumulate to dangerous levels
notes.alternatives: Consider mounts, magical transportation, or accepting slower travel when possible

whenToUse: When time is genuinely critical and worth the risk
When the party has high Constitution scores
whenToAvoid: When multiple party members have low Constitution
For extended periods (more than 2-3 extra hours)
In extremely difficult terrain or environmental conditions
